resources.string: Muffled audio? Our high-intensity sonic pulses can eject trapped water and dislodge dust from your speaker mesh.
Set volume to MAXIMUM for best results.
Place the phone facing down on a flat surface.
Follow these steps to ensure maximum cleaning effectiveness:
Disconnect all headphones (Wired or Bluetooth). Sound must play through the internal speakers.
Close other apps that are playing music or videos.
Set volume to 100%. Lower volume reduces the physical vibration needed to move particles.
Lay the phone speaker-side down. Gravity helps moisture escape the mesh.
Do not use this service during a phone call.
Avoid moving or shaking the phone while the repair is running.
Speaker Cleaner uses specialized sound algorithms to physically repair audio quality.
Uses low-frequency sine waves (150Hz - 600Hz). These frequencies cause high "excursion" (movement) of the speaker cone, physically shaking water droplets off the hardware.
Uses rapid, accelerating "Square-Clipped" pulses. These act like a jackhammer, creating bursts of air pressure to dislodge dry dust and lint trapped in the speaker pores.
If sound is still muffled, wait 2 minutes and repeat the process.
Use manual controls to target specific frequencies or test your speakers.
Adjusts the pitch from 100Hz to 1000Hz. Use lower Hz (150-200) for heavy water droplets, and higher Hz for fine dust.
Intermittently cuts the sound. This rapid "On/Off" creates shockwaves of air pressure that are more effective at pushing out stuck particles than continuous sound.
Synchronizes the phone\'s vibration motor with the audio pulses for maximum physical agitation.
The songs \'Legendary Paganini Caprice House\' and \'Nightlife in Hamburg Synth Pop\' are provided by White_Records, sourced from pixabay.com.
